trans-unit.source: The TIME function returns a time from a value.

seg-source.mrk: The TIME function returns a time from a value.

target.mrk: The TIME function returns a time from a value.

trans-unit.source: The argument must be a time, timestamp, or a valid string representation of a time or timestamp that is not a CLOB, LONG VARCHAR, or XML value. The result of the function is a time. If the argument can be null, the result can be null; if the argument is null, the result is the null value.

seg-source.mrk: The argument must be a time, timestamp, or a valid string representation of a time or timestamp that is not a CLOB, LONG VARCHAR, or XML value.
The result of the function is a time.
If the argument can be null, the result can be null; if the argument is null, the result is the null value.

target.mrk: The argument must be a time, timestamp, or a valid string representation of a time or timestamp that is not a CLOB, LONG VARCHAR, or XML value.
The result of the function is a time.
If the argument can be null, the result can be null; if the argument is null, the result is the null value.

trans-unit.source: The other rules depend on the data type of the argument specified:

seg-source.mrk: The other rules depend on the data type of the argument specified:

target.mrk: The other rules depend on the data type of the argument specified:

trans-unit.source: If the argument is a time: The result is that time.

seg-source.mrk: If the argument is a time: The result is that time.

target.mrk: If the argument is a time: The result is that time.

trans-unit.source: If the argument is a timestamp: The result is the time part of the timestamp.

seg-source.mrk: If the argument is a timestamp: The result is the time part of the timestamp.

target.mrk: If the argument is a timestamp: The result is the time part of the timestamp.

trans-unit.source: If the argument is a string: The result is the time represented by the string.

seg-source.mrk: If the argument is a string: The result is the time represented by the string.

target.mrk: If the argument is a string: The result is the time represented by the string.

trans-unit.source: If the current time is 5:03 PM, the value returned is <codeph>17:03:00</codeph>.

seg-source.mrk: If the current time is 5:03 PM, the value returned is <codeph>17:03:00</codeph>.

target.mrk: If the current time is 5:03 PM, the value returned is <codeph>17:03:00</codeph>.
